intro: Geraniospermum fumarioides, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant has adapted to harsh desert conditions with a deep root system and succulent leaves that store water. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Geraniospermum fumarioides plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
